venue: Computer Science building of the University of Salerno, Via Ponte don Melillo, Fisciano (SA), Italy
intro: The sixth edition of the International Summer School on Software Engineering intends to provide a contribution to PhD students and academic and industrial researchers on latest findings in the field of Software Engineering.The invited lecturers are internationally recognised research leaders and will cover very relevant topics for the scientific community, including Requirements Engineering, Software Architectures, Distributed Systems, Wireless Sensor Networks, Software Maintenance, Software Measurement, Agile Software Development, Open Source Software, and Software Product Lines.The program of the school will aim at creating discussion forums betweenlecturers and industrial and academic attendees.

lectures.name: Jeff
lectures.title: Model-based design and analysis of concurrent programs

lectures.name: Gian Pietro
lectures.title: Wireless Sensor Networks: State-of-the-Art and Challenges for Software Engineers

lectures.name: Lori
lectures.title: Developing Natural Language-based Software Analyses & Tools to Expedite Software Maintenance

lectures.name: Frank
lectures.title: Open source practices in software product line engineering

supporters.name: Facoltà di Scienze Matematiche Fisiche e Naturali, Università di Salerno
